content:

  • CBOU

    More on Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU): Q1 EPS comes in line while revenue misses slightly. The...

    More on Caribou Coffee (NASDAQ:CBOU): Q1 EPS comes in line while revenue misses slightly. The company says its single-cup coffee business continues to experience significant growth, but "recent industry trends lead us to believe this business line will experience a moderation in its growth trajectory for the remainder of 2012." As a result, it cuts FY12 guidance, now expecting to earn $0.47 - $0.50 per share on sales growth of about 6% to 8%. Street estimates are for $0.57 per share on 10% sales growth. Shares -7.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 PM | 3 Comments

  • BAGL

    More on Einstein Noah (NASDAQ:BAGL): Q1 beats across the board. System-wide comparable store...

    More on Einstein Noah (NASDAQ:BAGL): Q1 beats across the board. System-wide comparable store sales increased 1.1%, reflecting 5.0% growth in average check levels, primarily driven by strong catering sales. Separately, announces a review of strategic alternatives, including a possible business combination or sale of the company. Shares +29% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM
  • LPL

    LG Display (LPL -6.1%) fell hard after prosecutors raided the company's offices for information...

    LG Display (LPL -6.1%) fell hard after prosecutors raided the company's offices for information to determine if it illegally obtained OLED display technology from employees of OLED market leader Samsung. Volatile Universal Display (PANL -7%), which licenses its OLED technology and sells display materials to LG, also fell. National Securities is staying bullish on PANL, but thinks the raid could push back LG's May OLED TV launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • BODY

    More on Body Central (OTCQB:BODY): Q1 comes in-line with estimates. Overall revenue rose 11.8%...

    More on Body Central (OTCQB:BODY): Q1 comes in-line with estimates. Overall revenue rose 11.8% Y/Y on a 13.6% rise in net store sales and a 10.1% increase in direct sales. The stock is being hammered in the post session however as the company lowers its Q2 forecast. It now expects an EPS of $0.26 - $0.28 per share and revenue to be in the range of $80M - $82M. Street estimates are for $87M in revenue and earnings of $0.36 per share. Shares -30.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum Communications (NASDAQ:SPRD): Q1 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $161.1M...

    Spreadtrum Communications (NASDAQ:SPRD): Q1 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $161.1M (+17.5% Y/Y) beats by $1M. EPS beat due to government subsidies and lower 3G R&D spending. Company expects Q2 revenue of $170M-$175M, above $165.5M consensus. SPRD +15.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM

  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -7.6%) closed at levels last seen in early January after Viacom (VIA, VIAB) stated...

    Netflix (NFLX -7.6%) closed at levels last seen in early January after Viacom (VIA, VIAB) stated on its FQ2 earnings call Epix's movies will be available on Netflix "under any circumstance," but other streaming partners might also be added. Last week, it was reported Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is talking to Epix, which Viacom co-owns with LGF and MGM, about a streaming deal. Netflix's exclusivity ends in September.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 8 Comments

    TriQuint (TQNT) +4.1% AH after announcing a $50M stock repurchase program, good for buying back 6.5% of outstanding shares based on today's closing price. TriQuint was crushed last week due to the poor Q2 guidance accompanying its Q1 report. (PR)

  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell (NYSE:CBB) +10.7% AH after announcing (along with its Q1 report) it plans to...

    Cincinnati Bell (NYSE:CBB) +10.7% AH after announcing (along with its Q1 report) it plans to pursue an IPO for its CyrusOne data center subsidiary, while adding it's assessing its ability to operate CyrusOne as a real estate investment. CBB is looking to take advantage of a red-hot market for data center construction and (in many cases) the companies behind it. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • CP

    Proxy advisory firm ISS strongly endorses Bill Ackman’s alternative slate of directors for...

    Proxy advisory firm ISS strongly endorses Bill Ackman’s alternative slate of directors for Canadian Pacific Railway (CP -1.7%) as well as his call for a new CEO: “Even in the relatively stronger years of 2006 and 2007, when the company achieved its lowest [operating ratios] under the current CEO, the rate of Y/Y improvement was markedly lower than for the average U.S. peer."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) has resumed trading following its major Q1 miss. Shares are only down...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) has resumed trading following its major Q1 miss. Shares are only down 0.5% - for now at least, the Street thinks shares have suffered enough, given the company's restructuring efforts and management changes.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • SWIR

    Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ:SWIR): Q1 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $150.3M (+4% Y/Y)...

    Sierra Wireless (NASDAQ:SWIR): Q1 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $150.3M (+4% Y/Y) beats by $4.9M. Expects Q2 revenue of $157M-$162M and EPS of $0.18-$0.21, above consensus of $152.4M and $0.12. SWIR +16.5% AH. Figures contrast sharply with those in rival Novatel's (NVTL) Q1 report. (PR)

    Multi-Fineline Electronix (NASDAQ:MFLX): FQ2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $208M (flat...

    Multi-Fineline Electronix (NASDAQ:MFLX): FQ2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $208M (flat Y/Y) misses by $10.1M. Company expects FQ3 revenue of $160M-$180M, well below $221.3M consensus. The company, which is a major Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) circuit board supplier, said it "saw a softening in orders from ... key customers" towards the end of FQ2. MFLX -28.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • DLB

    Dolby Laboratories (NYSE:DLB): FQ2 EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $260.3M (+4% Y/Y)...

    Dolby Laboratories (NYSE:DLB): FQ2 EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $260.3M (+4% Y/Y) beats by $4.8M. Expects FY12 revenue of $910M-$960M and EPS of $2.80-$3.04 vs. consensus of $942.4M and $2.57. Company is also announcing a deal with Microsoft to integrate Dolby Digital Pus technology within Windows 8. Shares +14.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • MSFT

    More on LinkedIn's Q1: Hiring Solutions revenue +121% Y/Y, now makes up 54% of sales. Marketing...

    More on LinkedIn's Q1: Hiring Solutions revenue +121% Y/Y, now makes up 54% of sales. Marketing Solutions (ads) +73%, Premium Subscriptions +91%. International revenue 36% of total (up from 33% in Q4). Registered users grew by 11M Q/Q to 161M. Sales & marketing expenses +124% Y/Y, exceeding revenue growth. R&D expenses +91%. LNKD +10.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM

    QLogic (NASDAQ:QLGC): FQ4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $135M (-11.3% Y/Y) misses by...

  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $188.5M (+101% Y/Y) beats by $9.9M....

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $188.5M (+101% Y/Y) beats by $9.9M. Expects Q2 revenue of $210M-$215M and 2012 revenue of $880M-$900M, above a consensus of $207.9M and $876.8M. Company is also announcing the acquisition of presentation-sharing site SlideShare for $118.8M (45% cash, 55% stock). LNKD +7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • FSLR

    More on First Solar's Q1: In spite of the massive Q1 miss, the company is lifting its 2012 EPS...

    More on First Solar's Q1: In spite of the massive Q1 miss, the company is lifting its 2012 EPS guidance to $4-$4.50 from $3.75-$4.25 ($4.07 consensus) thanks to its cost-cutting efforts. Operating cash flow guidance range is raised by $50M. No revenue guidance is provided. Q1 gross margin was just 15.4%, down from 45.8% a year ago. FSLR still halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • AVP

    More on that Avon (NYSE:AVP) bid: Richmont Holdings, the owner of Mary Kay and Dirt Devil, is...

    More on that Avon (NYSE:AVP) bid: Richmont Holdings, the owner of Mary Kay and Dirt Devil, is putting together an offer for AVP to rival the $10B bid from Coty that Avon rejected last month. AVP is up 9.2% since the news broke at market close.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.67. Revenue of $497.1M (-27% Y/Y)...

    | 4:09 PM | 9 Comments
  • AIG

    AIG (NYSE:AIG): Q1 EPS of $1.65 vs. consensus expectations of $1.12. Core insurance operating...

    AIG (NYSE:AIG): Q1 EPS of $1.65 vs. consensus expectations of $1.12. Core insurance operating income of $2.4B and book value per share of $57.68 vs. year-ago $44.33. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 21 Comments
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (JIVE -4.6%) underperformed following a critical Street Sweeper report questioning...

    Jive Software (JIVE -4.6%) underperformed following a critical Street Sweeper report questioning its rich valuation, and pointing out insiders could dump shares following its June IPO share lock-up expiration. The site also argues Jive's bookings growth is slowing down even as opex continues to surge, and takes shots at the track records of its execs.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • END

    Shares of Endeavour (END -6.5%) slip after being downgraded to Neutral at Pritchard earlier...

    Shares of Endeavour (END -6.5%) slip after being downgraded to Neutral at Pritchard earlier today, citing uncertainty surrounding closing the Alba transaction with Conoco (COP -0.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBOW

    Swift Energy (SFY -11.3%) shares plunge after Q1 results declined more than expected despite...

    Swift Energy (SFY -11.3%) shares plunge after Q1 results declined more than expected despite production growth of 6% to 2.8M boepd vs. 2.65M a year ago. Revenues fell a larger-than-expected 6% as a 43% slump in natural gas prices more than offset a 14% rise in realized oil prices. Like others, SFY says it is continuing to push more into liquids as natural gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) officially sets its IPO price range at $28-$35 in a new S-1. The company...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) officially sets its IPO price range at $28-$35 in a new S-1. The company plans to sell 337.4M shares (180M in new shares, 157.4M from insiders) for a total offering size of $9.45B-$11.8B, higher than many expected. Mark Zuckerberg will sell 30.2M shares. The over-allotment option is 50.6M shares. Facebook's expected valuation range is $77B-$96B after factoring in restricted shares and options. IPO plays are following the tech sector lower: GSVC -3%. SVVC -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • MUR

    Murphy Oil (MUR -6.2%) shares slide after Q1 earnings and revenues miss analyst targets, and the...

    Murphy Oil (MUR -6.2%) shares slide after Q1 earnings and revenues miss analyst targets, and the company lowers guidance on full-year 2012 production to ~193,000 boepd, the eighth full-year guidance reduction in the last nine quarters. UBS maintains its Neutral rating on the stock but cuts its price target to $60 from $66.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • CLR

    On a bad day all around for energy stocks (XLE -1.8%), Continental Resources (CLR -8.2%) fares...

    On a bad day all around for energy stocks (XLE -1.8%), Continental Resources (CLR -8.2%) fares worst than most after its Q1 results missed analyst estimates, hurt by higher operating costs. CLR forecast 47%-50% production growth in 2012 on increased spending of $2.3B after already raising expectations twice this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • GMCR

    The big moves in Green Mountain (GMCR -48%) and Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.91%) recently have...

    The big moves in Green Mountain (GMCR -48%) and Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.91%) recently have value investors chomping at the bit to scoop up shares at deep discounts. To do so however, is akin to trying to catch a falling knife. "You have to distinguish between just setbacks and atrophy of business model,” says Short Hill Capital's Stephen Weiss. If you don't, you might just find yourself getting impaled by tempation. Some safer bets might be: Starbucks (SBUX -2%), Visa (V -4.6%), or McDonald's (MCD -0.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 16 Comments
  • PMC

    PharMerica (PMC +3.7%) moves up after beating Q1 estimates late yesterday. Total revenue...

    PharMerica (PMC +3.7%) moves up after beating Q1 estimates late yesterday. Total revenue actually declined 6.8% Y/Y, but margins were boosted by stronger cash flow. RBC ups the shares to Outperform on the report, citing valuation, better visibility and positive earnings growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • FSYS

    A big earnings miss from Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS -19.9%) drives shares lower as higher...

    A big earnings miss from Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS -19.9%) drives shares lower as higher costs turn what was forecast to be a small profit into a loss for the quarter. The company says visibility of the alternative fuel market will be low until H2 when new models launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +22%) takes off after striking a patent licensing deal with Aastra, a maker of IP...

    VirnetX (VHC +22%) takes off after striking a patent licensing deal with Aastra, a maker of IP communications gear for enterprises. The deal puts an end to litigation between the companies, and results in VirnetX receiving a one-time licensing fee and ongoing royalties. The agreement, which comes a week after a favorable Markman ruling, is fueling hopes similar deals will be reached with Cisco, Apple, and NEC.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • IO

    Ion Geophysical (IO +14.6%) shares power higher after its Q1 report showed profit jumped...

    Ion Geophysical (IO +14.6%) shares power higher after its Q1 report showed profit jumped dramatically on stronger sales, and the provider of services for the oil and gas industry predicted results would improve for each remaining quarter of 2012 "based on our market outlook and robust pipeline of order activity."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • VOLC

    Volcano (VOLC +3.4%) moves higher despite coming up short on its Q1 results late yesterday, as...

    Volcano (VOLC +3.4%) moves higher despite coming up short on its Q1 results late yesterday, as Goldman raises the shares to Conviction Buy with a potential 28% upside. Goldman calls the company a "unique asset," noting that its fractional flow reserve business is ramping up and sees strong trends developing in its medical franchise business.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • MMYT

    Shares of MakeMyTrip (MMYT -1.1%) shoot up over 6% before quickly retreating after the company...

    Shares of MakeMyTrip (MMYT 6-K with the SEC stating that JetBlue and IndiGo will resume selling tickets on its site.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5.8%) is making 8-year lows on the final day of its panned BlackBerry...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5.8%) is making 8-year lows on the final day of its panned BlackBerry World conference; shares are now down 16% since the conference began. Network World reports attending enterprise customers had mixed feelings about RIM, expressing concerns about the cost of deploying its Mobile Fusion device management solution, and about strong employee interest in using rival devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • APOL

    A discouraging forecast from Corinthian Colleges cuts a wide swath of losses through the...

    A discouraging forecast from Corinthian Colleges cuts a wide swath of losses through the education sector as a host of names continue to battle a double-whammy of concerns on federal funding and the quality of the education offered for the high tuition charged. Decliners: APOL -2.2%, ESI-OLD -6.6%, EDMC -7.6%, STRA -4.4%, DV -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBC

    Regal-Beloit (RBC -1.2%) slides on a downgrade to Equal Weight on valuation at Stephens...

    Regal-Beloit (RBC -1.2%) slides on a downgrade to Equal Weight on valuation at Stephens following the company's mixed Q1 results. The firm also lowers its price target to $72 from $77.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN +1.5%) continues to battle back from yesterdays's 6% selloff after missing Q1...

    Allergan (AGN +1.5%) continues to battle back from yesterdays's 6% selloff after missing Q1 estimates, helped by positive comments out of Susquehanna this morning. The firm says AGN posted a good quarter, but wasn't surprised by the selloff and believe it's been overdone. Susquehanna says AGN adequately explained its shortcomings and expects to see growth accelerate through the remainder of the year. Worth noting: Jefferies says valuation is still rich on a relative basis, trading at around 20x estimates, versus its peers at 12x.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • TDC

    Teradata (TDC +7.4%) makes new highs after a Q1 beat fueled by a 31% Y/Y increase in product...

    Teradata (TDC +7.4%) makes new highs after a Q1 beat fueled by a 31% Y/Y increase in product sales. The company is now guiding for 2012 revenue growth of 12%-14% and EPS of $2.60-$2.70, compared with a consensus of 12.3% and $2.64. FBN is pleased with the acceleration seen in Teradata's sales to the Americas (+26% Y/Y), as demand for its data warehousing and analytics solutions picks up. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • GMCR

    Josh Brown excoriates the analysts for their bullishness on Green Mountain (GMCR -48%),...

    Josh Brown excoriates the analysts for their bullishness on Green Mountain (GMCR -48%), especially the 69% who had a Buy rating despite David Einhorn's short thesis and the insider selling. A "punk analyst sitting in his office" doesn't know the pain of having "suffered through a hundred disasters just like Green Mountain." Those who manage real money do.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake's (NYSE:CHK) controversies also weigh on Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM -4.9%)....

    Chesapeake's (NYSE:CHK) controversies also weigh on Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM -4.9%). In downgrading CHKM shares, Citi cites the increased risk following the stock volatility of the partnership's general partner and largest customer. The firm doessn't draw conclusions on CHK's ultimate fate, but "it seems prudent to look at the potential impacts on the partnership."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • CSII

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +2.5%) trades higher after William Blair upped the shares to...

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +2.5%) trades higher after William Blair upped the shares to Outperform earlier today, citing an improved growth trajectory on the back of the company's Q3 results.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR -4%) sells off after Caris' John Slack starts coverage with an Average rating....

    Juniper (JNPR -4%) sells off after Caris' John Slack starts coverage with an Average rating. Slack thinks expectations of a recovery in carrier spending (64% of Juniper's sales) are baked into estimates, and is worried about macro conditions and Juniper's ability to quickly convert bookings into revenue. Yesterday, JDS Uniphase (JDSU -3.9%) said delays in carrier orders were partly responsible for its FQ3 revenue weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM

    Quanta Services (PWR +3.8%) gains after posting Q1 results that easily beat estimates earlier...
